topic.title: Repositioning the Neutral Jumper Bus Bar

li.p: A licensed electrician or an Eaton service representative must adjust transformer output voltage.
Severe or fatal injury can result from electrical shock during contact with high voltage conductors, monitoring PCBs, or similar equipment.
The PDU MUST BE DE ENERGIZED before working on unit. “Hot work” is not allowed.
Wear suitable personal protective clothing and use protective equipment for performing mechanical and electrical installations.

body.note: If the PDU is on warranty, this procedure must be performed by an Eaton service representative other Eaton-authorized service technician. Making changes to the PDU may void your warranty. See also section Warranty.
body.p:
The following procedure explains how to reposition the neutral jumper bus bar when reconfiguring a 3-output transformer with secondary output voltages of 480VAC, 415VAC, and 208VAC.
Remove rear PDU panels.
Locate the neutral jumper bus. Remove 20 bolts (3/8-16 x 1-1/4) from the five (5) bus connections as shown in . (Note how the fastener hardware is installed; you will reinstall the hardware in the same way.) Hardware fasteners by count:
20 bolts
40 Belleville washers
20 washers
20 self-clinching nuts It is recommended Belleville washers be replaced with new Belleville washers.
Remove the neutral jumper bus.
On the old tap connections:
Clean the connection surfaces of both the taps and the neutral jumper bus; remove any debris or torque seal by lightly scuffing with high grain sand paper. Take care that debris does not fall into transformer windings.
To prevent rust, apply anti-oxidation grease on the surface of these voltage taps.
For the new tap connections:
Locate the desired voltage setting on the side of the neutral bus bar as shown in .
Clean off existing anti-oxidation grease on the voltage taps prior to installing the neutral jumper bus.
Install the neutral bus jumper at the voltage position selected in step 5a using hardware saved in step 2.
Please note:
480VAC requires jumper ends to face down
415VAC and 208VAC require jumper ends to face up
Connect neutral bus jumper to taps using fastener hardware reserved in Step 2.
Torque connections to specifications in .
Apply torque seal to all connections for visible verification of torque.
